articles.headline: A Dispute Over Filling Prescriptions
articles.snippet: Walgreen and CVS issued dueling statements about plans to stop filling prescriptions from the other’s customers.
articles.abstract: Walgreen and CVS issued dueling statements about plans to stop filling prescriptions from the other’s customers.
articles.lead_paragraph: A fight has broken out between the nation’s biggest drugstore chains, Walgreen and CVS Caremark, potentially affecting where millions of consumers can fill their prescriptions.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson and Natasha Singer

articles.headline: The Man, the Mouse and the Wardrobe
articles.snippet: Socks, underwear, or high-end jeans and shirts you design yourself: Internet services can provide them all.
articles.abstract: Socks, underwear, or high-end jeans and shirts you design yourself: Internet services can provide them all.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, FedEx dropped off an enormous box of clothes picked out for me by Carrie Harrison, my personal style consultant. Though we’ve never met in person, Ms. Harrison, a former clothing retailer who recently became a personal shopper, had somehow chosen several items perfectly suited to my tastes. There were many lovely shirts, an amazing pair of designer jeans and brown leather zip-up boots that will garner several compliments for my dazzling sense of fashion.

articles.headline: New iPhone Apps Put You in the Mix
articles.snippet: Tone deaf? Don’t know a half note from a whole rest? Doesn’t matter. Two new iPhone apps help you perform with Taylor Swift and the “Glee” TV show.
articles.abstract: Tone deaf? Don’t know a half note from a whole rest? Doesn’t matter. Two new iPhone apps help you perform with Taylor Swift and the “Glee” TV show.
articles.lead_paragraph: People always say that an app phone — an iPhone or Android phone for example — is like a cross between a phone and a laptop. Sorry, but that’s nuts.

articles.headline: Views Show How North Korea Policy Spread Misery
articles.snippet: Interviews with eight people who recently left North Korea paint a haunting portrait of desperation and political resentment.
articles.abstract: Interviews with eight people who recently left North Korea paint a haunting portrait of desperation and political resentment.
articles.lead_paragraph: YANJI, China  Like many North Koreans, the construction worker lived in penury. His state employer had not paid him for so long that he had forgotten his salary. Indeed, he paid his boss to be listed as a dummy worker so that he could leave his work site. Then he and his wife could scrape out a living selling small bags of detergent on the black market.

articles.headline: While You Were Sleeping...
articles.snippet: The electronics industry is betting on sophisticated, Internet-enabled versions of the clock radio to rejuvenate the humble bedside device.
articles.abstract: The electronics industry is betting on sophisticated, Internet-enabled versions of the clock radio to rejuvenate the humble bedside device.
articles.lead_paragraph: FOR many people, the dawn of the digital age  or at least the first recognition of its advent  probably did not come with utility bills on punch cards warning never to fold, spindle or mutilate. Most Americans did not wake up to the new era by reading ads for do-it-yourself Heathkit computers in Popular Mechanics magazine.

articles.headline: Music Your Way: Stretching the Limits
articles.snippet: A range of new products can help you get more out of your iPod.
articles.abstract: A range of new products can help you get more out of your iPod.
articles.lead_paragraph: IT’S June, and you want to give the gift of audio to the father in your life, or the new graduate or your neighbor who has a fondness for Flag Day.

articles.headline: China’s Hunger Fuels  Exports in Remote Russia
articles.snippet: Russian companies are clamoring to sign deals over materials like iron, coal and timber to sell into the insatiable Chinese market.
articles.abstract: Russian companies are clamoring to sign deals over materials like iron, coal and timber to sell into the insatiable Chinese market.
articles.lead_paragraph: BIROBIDZHAN, Russia  The Kimkan open pit mine in Siberia is a muddy square mile surrounded by birch and cedar forests so vast they seem to stretch to the ends of the earth.

articles.headline: Saving Chevrolet Means Sending ‘Chevy’ to Dump
articles.snippet: General Motors has asked employees to refer to its best-known brand of vehicles as Chevrolets, not Chevys.
articles.abstract: General Motors has asked employees to refer to its best-known brand of vehicles as Chevrolets, not Chevys.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bye-bye, indeed, Miss American Pie. If General Motors has its way, you won’t be driving your Chevy to the levee ever again.

articles.headline: Wal-Mart Finds Ally in Education
articles.snippet: American Public Education, which operates two Web-based universities, got a big boost in profile and share price after agreeing to a deal with Wal-Mart.
articles.abstract: American Public Education, which operates two Web-based universities, got a big boost in profile and share price after agreeing to a deal with Wal-Mart.
articles.lead_paragraph: What promises to be a lucrative arrangement between the country’s largest retailer and an education company based in West Virginia started with an unsolicited e-mail message in October.
